#summary Notes about using JUnit from Ant

= Configuration =

Taken from [http://www.manning-source.com/books/hatcher/hatcher_ch04.pdf Java Development with Ant]


{{{
    <target name="test" description="Run junit tests for ${module.name}">
        <delete dir="${module.test.output}"/>
        <mkdir dir="${module.test.output}"/>
        <junit printsummary="withOutAndErr" errorProperty="test.failed" failureProperty="test.failed">
            <classpath>
                <path refid="module.classpath"/>
                <pathelement location="${module.test.classes}"/>
            </classpath>
            <formatter type="plain" usefile="false"/>
            <test name="${testcase}" todir="${module.test.output}" if="testcase"/>
            <batchtest todir="${module.test.output}" unless="testcase">
                <fileset dir="${module.test.classes}">
                    <include name="**/Test*.class"/>
                    <include name="**/*Test.class"/>
                </fileset>
            </batchtest>
        </junit>
        
        <fail message="Tests failed. Check log and/or reports." if="test.failed"/>
    </target>
}}}
